contents.item: The scarcity of time is the reason we have to concentrate on one thing at a time.
contents.owner: Matt Perman, What's Best Next: How the Gospel Transforms the Way You Get Things Done

contents.item: Hopefully and devoutly focus on your greater possibilities.
contents.owner: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life

contents.item: Now I feel free, and hope is creeping back. Maybe because I'm paying attention to what I have rather than what's missing.
contents.owner: Doug   Cooper, Outside In

contents.item: Stop obsessing about where you invest your money. Focus instead, on where you invest your time.
contents.owner: Gyan Nagpal

contents.item: Personally, I’m choosing to dwell upon the glory of the kingdom of which I am a part, even though I’m still a witness and sometimes a victim of the junk in ‘this’ world.
contents.owner: Van Harden, Life in the Purple Wedge!

contents.item: Adversity is inevitable. Staying positive is optional.
contents.owner: Maddy Malhotra, How to Build Self-Esteem and Be Confident: Overcome Fears, Break Habits, Be Successful and Happy

contents.item: Challenges are inevitable. Happiness is optional.
contents.owner: Maddy Malhotra, How to Build Self-Esteem and Be Confident: Overcome Fears, Break Habits, Be Successful and Happy

contents.item: Problems are inevitable. Staying in control of your emotions is optional.
contents.owner: Maddy Malhotra, How to Build Self-Esteem and Be Confident: Overcome Fears, Break Habits, Be Successful and Happy

contents.item: Life is simple. It is meant to be lived. Don't over-complicate things. Don't lose your life in the things that don't matter.
contents.owner: Akiroq Brost

contents.item: Focusing is about saying No.
contents.owner: Steve Jobs

contents.item: Simplicity is ultimately a matter of focus.
contents.owner: Ann Voskamp, One Thousand Gifts: A Dare to Live Fully Right Where You Are

contents.item: It's as if when I open myself up to every perception, things create their own focus.
contents.owner: Kristin Cashore, Graceling

contents.item: Be on guard. The road widens, and many of the detours are seductive.
contents.owner: David Foster Wallace, Infinite Jest

contents.item: What are the five products you want to focus on? Get rid of the rest, because they’re dragging you down. They’re turning you into Microsoft. They’re causing you to turn out products that are adequate but not great.
contents.owner: Walter Isaacson, Steve Jobs

contents.item: ...you cannot eat every tadpole and frog in the pond, but you can eat the biggest and ugliest one, and that will be enough, at least for the time being.
contents.owner: Brian Tracy, Eat That Frog!: 21 Great Ways to Stop Procrastinating and Get More Done in Less Time

contents.item: Find your focus by seeking all that is good in your life.
contents.owner: Lorii Myers, Make It Happen, A Healthy, Competitive Approach to Achieving Personal Success

contents.item: I wanna be the best in at least one thing in this life.
contents.owner: Toba Beta

contents.item: The difference between successful people and very successful people is that very successful people say “no” to almost everything.
contents.owner: Warren Buffett

contents.item: What you focus on grows!
contents.owner: Kelli Wilson, The Clutter Breakthrough: Your Five-Step Solution to Freedom from Clutter Forever

contents.item: A little distraction often helps you come back with sharper focus.
contents.owner: Tapan Ghosh
